body:
@calebthompson `db:test:prepare` does not work, really: `rake db:test:prepare --trace` outputs almost nothing (only `db:test:prepare` executing ), my test db is not updated. 
Now in 
```ruby
task :prepare do
  unless ActiveRecord::Base.configurations.blank?
    db_namespace['test:load'].invoke
  end
end
```
without `'db:abort_if_pending_migrations'` dependency (it is in rails 3) `ActiveRecord::Base.configurations.blank?` is true, so nothing is done.

A1) I have different databases for development and test. 

A2) 'rake spec' works, but I don't want to use it every time in development instead of 'rspec'.
